se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.event.api.producer

Interface EventProducer<T extends EventConsumer>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of EventConsumer which can be registered to this EventProducer.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Clusterable, EventConsumerWrapper<T>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEventProducer

    public interface EventProducer<T extends EventConsumer>
extends Clusterable, EventConsumerWrapper<T>
    EventProducer/EventGenerator specification, which produces a single type of event intended for a single type of EventConsumer. EventProducer instances should function correctly in a clustered environment.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<T> getConsumerType() 
      void notifyConsumers(EventConsumerCallback<T> consumerCallback)
      Perform a callback/notification to all registered EventConsumers using the provided ConsumerEventCallback instance.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.jguru.nazgul.core.clustering.api.Clusterable

        getClusterId

      • Methods inherited from interface se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.event.api.EventConsumerWrapper

        addConsumer, getConsumer, getConsumerIDs, removeConsumer

    • Method Detail

      • getConsumerType

        Class<T> getConsumerType()
        Returns:
        the type of [Event]Consumer handled by this EventProducer.

      • notifyConsumers

        void notifyConsumers(EventConsumerCallback<T> consumerCallback)
        Perform a callback/notification to all registered EventConsumers using the provided ConsumerEventCallback instance.
        Parameters:
        consumerCallback - an EventConsumer callback method, which cannot be null.
